body:
Because it would be convenient and more self-documenting. For example, our
systems can have a maximum precision of microseconds using RFC3339, and

timestampFormat := time.RFC3339Micro

is more semantically transparent than

timestampFormat := "2006-01-02T15:04:05.999999Z07:00"

Other "Handy time stamps" are already provided, so why not this?
